conclusion: To determine the amount of charge passing through R1 after the switch S is opened, analyze the circuit in two stages: when the switch is closed and when it is opened.
The switch S is closed, capacitors C1 and C2 are in parallel, and resistors R1 and R2 are in series.

premise: The voltage across each capacitor is the same as the power supply, E = 10V.
conclusion: The charge stored on each capacitor when the switch is closed is Q_initial = C * V = 300 μC.
The total initial charge is Q_total initial = 2 * 300 μC = 600 μC.
The switch S is opened, capacitors C1 and C2 are now in series.
The equivalent capacitance C_eq of two capacitors in series is C_eq = 15 μF.
The total charge Q_total final = Q_total initial = 600 μC.
The voltage across the equivalent capacitance V_final = 40 V.

premise: Initially, each capacitor had a charge of 300 μC.
conclusion: The final charge on each capacitor Q_final = 1200 μC.

premise: Capacitors are in series, charge on each must be the same.
conclusion: The charge on each capacitor is Q_final on each = 300 μC.

premise: Q_initial = 300 μC, Q_final on each = 300 μC.
conclusion: The charge passing through R1 is ΔQ = 0 μC.
